English (United States)(en-US): We did a good job putting our brains in Dot’s eyeballs.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 눈에 우리의 뇌를 넣은 건 정말 잘한 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): We could see Dot didn’t explode from the change in atmospheric pressure! Phew.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 기압차 때문에 터지지 않았다는 걸 알 수 있었다! 안심이 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, “phew.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 동의함.

English (United States)(en-US): Moreover, we could see our beautiful and splendid humans!! Once again!!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 게다가 인간!!을 다시금 바라볼 수 있었어! 우리의 아름답고 멋진 인간들을 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Again, agreed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 역시 동의한다.

English (United States)(en-US): Huh. True. Only one human—and none of the rest—could see Dot!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게. 뭉치가 한 명의 인간을 제외한 나머지 인간들에겐 보이지 않았어!

English (United States)(en-US): But why? Such an attribute wasn’t previously observed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 왜? 그러한 특성은 관찰되지 않았었는데?

English (United States)(en-US): Hm. The naked human eye? Dot’s composition? Or simply because they are small and black?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간의 눈? 뭉치의 성분? 혹은 그저 작고 까맣기 때문?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh! Right! Maybe it’s because of Dreaminisium!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어! 그렇네! 드리미네슘 때문일 수도 있겠네!

English (United States)(en-US): …… Highly possible. Will analyze the components of the Filth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… 가장 유력한 가설인 듯. 폐기물의 구성 성분을 조사해 보겠음.

English (United States)(en-US): Ring Boy must have woken up from that dream… and faced the worst morning of his life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반지 소년은 그 꿈을 꾸고 일어나… 최악의 슬픈 아침을 보냈겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): A void that devours me, one that’s mine. I can’t imagine having to live with it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 잡아먹는 나의 공허. 그것을 견뎌야만 한다니.

English (United States)(en-US): Having to take the blame… when none of it is my fault.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 잘못이 아님에도… 그 벌은 나의 것이어야만 한다니.

English (United States)(en-US): Red.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드.

English (United States)(en-US): It is a problem with no answer that stems from the human world. One beyond our comprehension.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것은 해답 없는 인간 세상의 난제. 우리는 채 이해 못 하는 인간들의 이야기.

English (United States)(en-US): Accept that it is beautiful in itself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 자체로 아름다운 것이라 받아들이면 됨.

English (United States)(en-US): I won’t. That story reminds me of my last human kid. Nothing beautiful there.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 싫어. 나의 마지막 인간 아이가 떠오른단 말이야. 그건 아름답지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Why would one beautiful human leave an ugly hole,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름다운 인간이 왜 다른 아름다운 인간에게

English (United States)(en-US): one that won’t mend for the rest of their life, on a fellow beautiful human?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 평생을 틀어 막고 살아도 메워지지 않는 추한 구멍을 남기는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): I… I still remember the looks on the faces of the humans that bullied my human kid.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아직도… 나의 인간을 괴롭히던 인간들의 표정이 생생하게 기억 나.

English (United States)(en-US): They weren’t beautiful. They were cowardly and awful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 정말로 아름답지 않았어. 비겁하고 끔찍했어.

English (United States)(en-US): It kills me to feel this way toward the humans I love… but I. I….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑하는 인간들에게 이런 마음을 가지는 것이 죄스럽지만… 난. 나는….

English (United States)(en-US): How else can I feel…?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달리 어떻게 느껴야 할지 모르겠단 말이야….

English (United States)(en-US): White Hat, spinning those endless faces! It was so awesome!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 수많은 얼굴들을 빙그르르 돌리던 하얀 모자 인간! 정말 황홀하고 아름다웠어!

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder if we have many faces inside too like that guy?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리 안에도 하얀 모자 인간처럼 수많은 얼굴들이 살고 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): We are filth cleaners on the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 그저 오물을 치우는 달 청소부들.

English (United States)(en-US): Multiple faces for us will be inefficient, rowdy and tiring.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리에게 다면성은 비효율적이고 시끄럽고 피로할 뿐.

English (United States)(en-US): One ‘face’ is enough.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘얼굴’은 하나면 충분함.

English (United States)(en-US): Nope! I want five of ‘em!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니! 나는 다섯 개 가지고 싶다!

English (United States)(en-US): And Sir Cello here wants seven!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 첼로 경은 일곱 개 가지고 싶다는데!

English (United States)(en-US): Why seven though?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 근데 왜 일곱 개지?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, do-re-mi-fa-sol-la-ti!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 도레미-파솔라시!

English (United States)(en-US): … Alright.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 그래.

English (United States)(en-US): How about you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 몇 개?

English (United States)(en-US): Three.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 세 개.

English (United States)(en-US): I know… I didn’t think Dot would miss us either. Kid’s gonna make me cry!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게… 우리를 보고 싶어 했을 줄은 몰랐어. 짜식, 감동인걸!

English (United States)(en-US): Zero possible ways for Dot to see us again.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 고민해도 뭉치가 우리를 다시 볼 수 있는 방법은 없다.

English (United States)(en-US): Ergo, Dot longs for us to no end.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 뭉치의 그리움은 길 없는 그리움.

English (United States)(en-US): We know well of how heavy it is. But even so……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 그 무게를 잘 알지. 하지만, 그럼에도……

English (United States)(en-US): I feel gratitude.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고마운 것 같음.

English (United States)(en-US): Yeah. If Dot really went for forgetting all about us it would’ve broken my heart…….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아. 뭉치가 정말 이곳에서의 기억을 잊겠다고 선택했으면 마음이 찢어졌을 거야…….

English (United States)(en-US): Not to worry, Cello. Dot showed no signs of possessing such abilities.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 걱정 마라, 첼로. 뭉치에게 그런 능력이 있다는 건 관찰하지 못했다.

English (United States)(en-US): Merely a fervent desire. Actual memory erasure will have been impossible.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 강렬한 소망이었을 뿐, 기억을 정말 지우지는 못했을 것임.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot is a clever creature. They must have known.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 똑똑한 괴물 덩어리니까. 아마 그도 알고 있었을 테지.

English (United States)(en-US): My dreams have long tended to humans, and I’ve come to love all of them…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그동안 꿈을 만들며 많은 인간들의 밤을 책임지며 그들을 한 명 한 명 사랑해 왔지만……

English (United States)(en-US): So it crushes me that they’re all gone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들 모두가 죽었다는 게 마음이 아파.

English (United States)(en-US): That every human I’ve never met but love, and will love, will all die one day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 만난 적은 없지만 사랑하는, 또 사랑할 모든 인간 역시 언젠가는 죽게 될 것이라는 것도.

English (United States)(en-US): Humans are said to leave a ‘will’ in preparation of their death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대부분의 인간은 죽음에 대비해, 혹은 그에 앞닥쳤을 때 ‘유언’을 적거나 남긴다고 함.

English (United States)(en-US): Its purpose is to encapsulate and organize the subject’s past,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 유언을 통해 지나온 과거를 함축해 정리하기도 하고,

English (United States)(en-US): or to wish for a future they will never be a part of.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자신은 가지 못할 미래를 빌어 보기도 함.

English (United States)(en-US): It is how the dying passes on to the living the meaning of their life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 죽는 자가 살아갈 자에게 전하는 것임. 자기 생의 의미를.

English (United States)(en-US): When the living remember the dead and bestow meaning to their life, one’s will is finally completed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 산 자가 죽은 자를 기억하며 그 의미를 부여할 때, 유언은 비로소 완성됨.

English (United States)(en-US): Existing because everyone dies—it is a very interesting culture.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모두가 죽기에 존재할 수 있는, 매우 흥미로운 문화이다.

English (United States)(en-US): A truly human culture.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 참으로 인간다운 문화.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot is dumb.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 찌질이 바보임.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought they were a clever blob of a monster.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 똑똑한 괴물 덩어리일 줄 알았는데.

English (United States)(en-US): I was so nervous thinking they would actually leave.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 떠날까 봐 어찌나 조마조마하던지.

English (United States)(en-US): Look. My hands are all sooty from pulling out my hair.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이것 봐. 머리 쥐어뜯느라 손이 다 시커매졌다니까.

English (United States)(en-US): …… It could get blacker?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …...더 시커매질 게 남았었던가?

English (United States)(en-US): Who are you calling a burnt-out matchstick! Am not, am not!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이미 성냥개비라니! 아니거든, 아니라고!

English (United States)(en-US): The human Dot observed today……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 뭉치가 보고 온 인간 말이야…….

English (United States)(en-US): His smile was so beautiful. It was like the world around him lit up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 웃을 때 참 아름다웠어. 주변이 환해지는 것 같았다고.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re blushing, Red.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얼굴이 빨갛다, 레드.

English (United States)(en-US): What? No! Why would you throw water at me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니! 아니! 왜 나에게 물을 붓지?

English (United States)(en-US): No! It takes me forever to dry myself and burn up again!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 싫어! 다시 타오르려면 한참을 말려야 한다고!

English (United States)(en-US): A-Anyway.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아-아무튼.

English (United States)(en-US): I hope that human can preserve his smile.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 인간이 자신의 웃음을 지켜 냈으면 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): “Once you’re entirely sad, you’ll be able to smile entirely as well?”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 온전히 슬퍼하다 보면, 온전히 웃을 수도 있을 거라고?

English (United States)(en-US): I think Dot said something similar earlier……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 비슷한 말을 했던 것 같은데…….

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t completely understand it, but there seems to be a splendid philosophy behind it! I like it!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘 이해되지는 않지만, 멋있는 철학이 담겨 있을 것만 같은 말이다! 좋아!

English (United States)(en-US): What? Really? I didn’t catch it, I was out cleaning filth with Old Man Chicory!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐? 정말? 치커리 영감이랑 오물 치우느라 못 봤어!

English (United States)(en-US): I knew Dot could do it! They finally delivered the letter! I’m so proud!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 이 자식, 결국 편지를 주러 다녀왔구나! 장하다!

English (United States)(en-US): …! Part of Dot’s body was ripped out when they tried to put the letter in the bag?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …! 가방에 넣으려다 몸이 지퍼에 뜯겼다고?

English (United States)(en-US): But then the ripped-out part grew back?!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 근데 또 다시 자라났어?!

English (United States)(en-US): What a relief……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다행이야…….

English (United States)(en-US): Anyway, do you think the child read the letter? I hope he did!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그나저나 아이가 편지를 읽었을까? 읽었으면 좋겠다!

English (United States)(en-US): Dot’s handwriting is so wiggly that I worry he won’t be able to decode it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 글씨체, 하도 찌글거려서 해독할 수는 있을까 걱정이군.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot dying once they become a dream… I never thought of it that way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 꿈이 되면 죽는다니… 한 번도 그렇게 생각해 본 적이 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): …… I basically egged Dot on to go and kick the bucket.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ……. 난 뭉치에게 사실상 죽으라고 권유한 셈인 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): What a suck-y stupid thing to say!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이거야말로 정말 나쁘고 멍청한 놈이나 할 법한 짓이잖아!

English (United States)(en-US): And to think Dot thought dreams live on forever in a human’s mind…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 게다가 꿈이 인간의 머릿속에서 영원히 살아가는 존재라고 믿고 있었을 줄은….

English (United States)(en-US): Who understands ‘dreams are forever friends’ like that!?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘꿈은 인간의 영원한 친구’란 표어를 어떻게 그렇게 해석할 수 있냐는 말이야!!

English (United States)(en-US): Calm down, Red. I too did not foresee this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드, 진정. 나 역시 미처 고려하지 못했음.

English (United States)(en-US): When what Dot heard on the Moon and what humans know of dreams did not click,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서 들었던 말들과, 인간들이 알고 있는 꿈에 대한 정보가 서로 부합하지 않을 때에는

English (United States)(en-US): Dot seems to have filled the resulting chasm with their own imagination.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 균열을 본인의 상상으로 채워 나갔던 것 같음.

English (United States)(en-US): Indeed. A foolish creature, more so than expected.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게. 저 괴물 덩어리, 생각보다 바보였음.

English (United States)(en-US): So now… what to do.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그나저나 정말… 이제 어쩌지.

English (United States)(en-US): How about we just… don’t worry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그냥… 우리 걱정 같은 건 하지 말고.

English (United States)(en-US): I’d rather they don’t end up a dream and live long. Dot’s kinda cute in a muddy way!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 되지 않고 오래 오래 살아 주면 좋겠어. 새까만 몸뚱이도 나름 귀엽단 말이야!

English (United States)(en-US): If only there was a way to tell them……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이걸 뭉치에게 전할 길이 있다면…….

English (United States)(en-US): I’m glad Dot’s human recognized us and our warmth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 인간이 우리의 따스함을 알아주어 다행이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): They called us ‘warmly layered melodies.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘따스하게 겹쳐 쌓인 선율 같은 이들’이라 해 줬다고.

English (United States)(en-US): Warmly layered melodies… sniff
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 따스하게 겹쳐 쌓인 선율... 훌쩍.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s just too much……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 감동적이야…….

English (United States)(en-US): But… thinking about the human Dot saw today makes me sad.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데… 오늘 뭉치가 보고 온 인간을 떠올리면 마음이 다시 아파져.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re right, wishing them the best. It’s all we can do.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아, 간절히 응원하기. 우리가 할 수 있는 유일한 일이지.

English (United States)(en-US): Something from the dark side of the Moon, impossible to see from Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구에선 보이지도 않는 달의 뒤편에서 보내는 응원이지만.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel useless. All we can do for a human in pain is to love them…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무력해. 고통에 찬 인간에게 해 줄 수 있는 게, 그를 사랑하는 것밖에 없어….

English (United States)(en-US): Really? Even if they can’t see or feel us, and don’t even know we exist, we can still help them?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말? 우리의 존재를 몰라도, 보거나 느낄 수조차 없어도 힘이 될 수 있다니?

English (United States)(en-US): Sincerity collects like snowflakes…? What does that mean?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음은 켜켜이 쌓인다…? 그게 무슨 뜻이지?

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm… mm… mmm… I’ve got nothing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음… 음… 으음… 여전히 모르겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): But… it has a nice ring to it!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만… 멋진 말이다!

English (United States)(en-US): Edison, Sir Cello! Have you heard of ‘lucid dreams?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 에디슨, 첼로 경! ‘루시드 드림’에 대해 알고 있었어?

English (United States)(en-US): Negative. Old Man Chicory used to know a little about it,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 처음 들음. 치커리 영감은 얼핏 알고 있는 듯했지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but his old age must have blurred his memory.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나이가 하도 먹어서인지 기억이 가물가물한 것 같음.

English (United States)(en-US): Whaaat? Your second human was a lucid dreamer?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐어? 두 번째로 맡았던 인간이 루시드 드리머였다고?

English (United States)(en-US): What was it like? How in the world! How are lucid dreams created?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어땠어? 어땠어? 세상에나 이런 일이! 루시드 드림은 어떻게 만들어지는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Wow! Cool! Edison, get this!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우와! 신기해! 에디슨, 이게 말이 돼?

English (United States)(en-US): Apparently, lucid dreamers have a tiny, special door attached to their Dream Marbles!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 루시드 드림을 터득한 인간들의 꿈 구슬에는 작고 특별한 문이 달려 있대!

English (United States)(en-US): So they walk inside their dreams through that door? This is so! so! magical and rare!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 문을 통해 꿈속으로 들어가는 거야? 너무! 너무! 신비롭고 희귀한 일이다!

English (United States)(en-US): Research. Research.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 연구. 연구.

English (United States)(en-US): …… E-Edison?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… 에, 에디슨?

English (United States)(en-US): Research needed. Research needed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 연구 필요함. 연구 필요함.

English (United States)(en-US): Her lightbulb head is… shining so bright!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 전구 머리가… 엄청나게 빛나고 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Do we have darknesses?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리에게도 암흑이 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Darkness….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑이라….

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm. It occurred to me last night.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음. 어젯밤 문득 이런 생각이 들었음.

English (United States)(en-US): We were designed to love humans and revolve around them,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 인간을 사랑하며 그 주위를 공전하도록 설계되었지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but cannot receive their gratitude affection, or acknowledgement. Especially since dreams are irrelevant to them, apparently…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결코 그들의 고마움도, 애정도, 인정도 받을 수 없지.\n그들은 꿈마저도 중요히 여기지 않는다고 하니….

English (United States)(en-US): I stared into space for three hours and contemplated on the unfairness of the matter.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 부조리하다고 생각하며 세 시간 동안 우주 너머를 바라보았음.

English (United States)(en-US): Lonely and stifling. I suspect I had been working through my own darkness at the time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 막막하고 답답했다. 아마 나는 그때 내 암흑 속을 헤엄치는 중이었겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): What? Sir Cello! You have nightmares every night? Geez……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐? 첼로 경! 첼로 경은 밤마다 악몽을 꾼다고? 저런…….

English (United States)(en-US): Humans are reported to utilize something called a sleep mask.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 수면 안대라는 것을 사용한다고 함.

English (United States)(en-US): I will attempt to construct a sleep mask prototype for you, Sir Cello.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 첼로 경을 위한 수면 안대 프로토타입을 한번 만들어 보겠음.

English (United States)(en-US): Me too… whenever I think about my human kid and how he walked into the cold cold water…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도… 차디찬 물로 걸어들어가던 그 인간 아이의 마지막 날을 떠올릴 때면

English (United States)(en-US): It makes me sadder than anything……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 엄청난 슬픔에 잠기게 돼……

English (United States)(en-US): Oooh……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으으….…

English (United States)(en-US): Even if the darkness inside makes us struggle and hurt.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리의 암흑이 아무리 우리를 어렵고 힘들게 한다지만.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t wanna hate it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미워하고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel like if the darkness goes away, so will the kid.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 머릿속에서 암흑을 떼어 내면 그 아이도 함께 사라질 것만 같거든.

English (United States)(en-US): I have a sad feeling that we have very little time until Dot leaves us.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치와의 작별이 얼마 남지 않았을 것만 같은 슬픈 예감이 들어.

English (United States)(en-US): (Sad music plays.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (슬픈 선율이 연주된다)

English (United States)(en-US): No more observing humans through Dot’s eyes, or cheering Dot on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 뭉치의 눈을 통해 인간들을 바라보는 것도, 뭉치의 여정을 응원하는 것도 할 수 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): We’ll have to go back to our monotonous days of cleaning, cleaning, and more cleaning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시 청소, 청소, 또 청소일 뿐인 일상으로 돌아가는 거야….

English (United States)(en-US): You think our time with Dot will have transformed us hugely?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치와 함께한 시간이 우리에게도 커다란 변화를 만들어 냈을 거라고?

English (United States)(en-US): … You’re correct. Even when we return, it won’t be the same as it was. I am sure of that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 맞아. 다시 돌아가도 예전 같지는 않을 것임. 분명히 알 수 있다.

English (United States)(en-US): Wait, I have a question.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 문득 궁금한 게 생겼어.

English (United States)(en-US): … In what shapes will we be imprinted on Dot’s human?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 우리는 뭉치의 인간에게 어떤 모양으로 각인될까?

English (United States)(en-US): Three beings, so a triangle?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세 명이니 세모난 모양?

English (United States)(en-US): Bahaha! I should laugh, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 웃어야 하는 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): Laugh.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 웃어라.
